page.title: 01THE WORSBROUGH AREA
page.content: {LAND COVER}- ranges from semi-rural sparsely populated areas to densely populated areas. {LOCAL HISTORY}- Houndhill, home of the Elmhirst family is an Elizabethan House. St. Mary's Church dates from 1115. The working Corn Mill was mentioned in the Domesday Book. The Industrial Revolution caused the opening of Worsbrough Reservoir and Canal in the early 19 century. {INDUSTRY}- Large employers of women are Corah's Sewing Factory and John Halliday. Langley's Boat Yard make equipment for the coal industry. {NOTABLE CHARACTERS}- Alan McKay is the M.P. for Penistone. National Union of Mineworkers President, Arthur Scargill, and his wife Ann, live in the area. {CHANGING WORLD}-in 1985 Barrow pit and a junior school closed.
